title: The Hut
body:
I've always loved nature. I would leave the comfort of my house to take walks in the park. The area I live in is considered somewhere in between urban and rural, a place where there is a fair amount of people and buildings yet with a few fields and forests nearby. It was summer time, perfect for a stroll. I had invited my friend Josh to hang out with me, go for a walk or something. We had decided to go into the forest where its quiet and you can't hear any cars in the distance, only leaves and the rustling sound of the tall trees above.

We had walked this familiar path before. It winded through the forest, up a and down a few small hills and across an area scattered with fallen branches and tree trunks. It was there, amidst the bramble and bushes where an eery delapidated hut stood.

This day, we followed the path as planned, and as it usually did, the hut caught our eyes.

There was something about it, even if we tried, we couldn't keep from looking at it. It was like something forced us to.

The rotting hut looked like it had been abandoned for a almost a decade. "Why is it there?" I asked myself. "What was inside it?"

Me and Josh were having a funny conversation about embarrassing events that happened to us when we were younger.

I was distracted by my particularly funny story when I realized Josh had stopped walking beside me.

It took me a moment to realize what was going on before I turned around to see him a little far behind.

He didn't look good. He stood frozen in place, pale as a ghost and breathing quickly, his eyes fixed on something behind me.

There was a sudden feeling of fear and unsettlement.

He turned his head with wide eyes to the right and stared in that direction without moving his body.

The only thing i could see moving was his hand shaking as if he was having a seizure, which he wasn't.

I turned my head to the left to see what caught his gaze.

I saw the hut... I stared at it as I thought about what I should do.

I could feel my heart pounding on the interior of my chest. constantly booming as if you were pounding on a door.

The silence was broken by Josh.

..

He screamed.

The sound that came out of his mouth sounded like the end of the world, as if a demon possessed him and tried to leave his body.

"WHO ARE YOU!" he exclaimed. "SHOW YOURSELF!" he demanded.

"Who the hell is he talking to?" I wondered in panic.

It was just then that Josh uncontrollably ran towards the old structure.

"Josh! Wait! Where are you-?", he stopped. He stood. He walked up the creaking footsteps, walked through the door and stopped...

The termite infested door, shut behind him.

I ran as fast as I possibly could off the path to the tiny building and pushed the door open...

with fear and shock in my eyes, adrenaline in my blood, I realized... I didn't see him, nor a trace.. He was gone... "What in the hell..?"

To be continued...
author: justchillshaiyan
